# [`{unhcrviz}`](https://edouard-legoupil.github.io/unhcrviz): A Chart Library on Forced Displacement

> \[!IMPORTANT\] This package was formerly known as `unhcrdatapackage`.
> It has been renamed to `unhcrviz`.

> “**Numbers have an important story to tell. They rely on YOU to give
> them a voice!**”

> – Stephen Few

The package conveniently bring together a series of predefined plots in
order to improve data literacy and facilitate the creation of
**[persuasive data
stories](https://edouard-legoupil.github.io/unhcrviz/tuto/tutorial.html)**.
You can also consult directly the [Data Storytelling
App](https://rstudio.unhcr.org/Data_Literacy/) created from this
package.

Each plot is created through a function that provides a **recipe** that
creates a re-usable chart in line with a [Divisible Content
Strategy](https://www.columnfivemedia.com/divisible-content-strategy-gives-brand-less/).
Those functions are then rendered through predefined Report templates
for Countries or Regions, generated either as html, PDF or PowerPoint
presentations. You may [enhance the charts story-telling
ability](https://edouard-legoupil.github.io/unhcrviz/articles/library.html)
by adjusting the message in the title, highlighting specific parts of
the data or adding annotation to ease interpretation or provide more
contextual background.

You can consult
[{unhcrreports}](https://matheus-hardt.github.io/unhcrreports/) to
benefit from AI automated analysis reports.

You can consult the default [Factsheets for the Americas through that
link](https://edouard-legoupil.github.io/unhcrviz/factsheet/factsheet.html).

Note, that if only need the data you can use directly
[`{refugees}`](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/refugees/index.html).
You can also explore data through [Refugee Data
Finder](https://www.unhcr.org/refugee-statistics/).

This package promotes [reproducible
approaches](https://unhcr-americas.github.io/reproducibility).If you are
UNHCR Staff and want to learn R, visit [UNHCR Learn & Connect- R
training](https://unhcr.csod.com/ui/lms-learner-playlist/PlaylistDetails?playlistId=e90e2279-e3a4-4ef2-8b74-757f91d224b2).
For Designers, convenient versions of each plot in **svg** format
(usable with Illustrator/Inkscape or Indesign/Scribus) can be generated
directly with: `unhcrthemes::unhcr_save(plot, "plot.svg")`.

## Missing chart

You can submit **request for new charts**
[here](https://github.com/Edouard-Legoupil/unhcrviz/issues/new)

**Contributions**, specifically creation of new functions for the chart
library are welcome! Please [consult instructions
here](https://edouard-legoupil.github.io/unhcrviz/articles/adding-new-charts.html)

## Install

The package comes with a shiny Interface available [Data Storytelling
App](https://rstudio.unhcr.org/Data_Literacy/)

You can also install the package locally to use it. If you are on
Windows, you will first need to install
[Rtools](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/) on the top of
[R](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/) and
[Rstudio](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/) in order to
install the package locally.

Make sure to have your **JAVA_HOME** environment variable set up as it
will be used for the map generation functions

    install.packages("pak")
    pak::pkg_install("edouard-legoupil/unhcrviz")

    ## you can then run the app locally with
    unhcrviz::run_app()

# Package index

## Chart for Country

Charts adressing questions at country level

- [`plot_ctr_asylum()`](plot_ctr_asylum.md) : Asylum Applications &
  Decision over time This charts allow to visualize trends in terms of
  asylum applications, decision and refugee status recognition
- [`plot_ctr_destination()`](plot_ctr_destination.md) : Main Destination
  from one specific countr
- [`plot_ctr_diff_in_pop_groups()`](plot_ctr_diff_in_pop_groups.md) :
  Increases and Decreases in Population Groups
- [`plot_ctr_disp_migrant()`](plot_ctr_disp_migrant.md) : Plotting ratio
  Refugee/Asylum-seekers vs Migrant within a country
- [`plot_ctr_keyfig()`](plot_ctr_keyfig.md) : Summary Key Figures Key
  figures can be highlighted with humanitarian icons
  https://fontawesome.com/icons/categories/humanitarian
- [`plot_ctr_location()`](plot_ctr_location.md) : Map of Destination
  Countries
- [`plot_ctr_origin_history()`](plot_ctr_origin_history.md) : Plot
  Origin History
- [`plot_ctr_origin_recognition()`](plot_ctr_origin_recognition.md) :
  Display A Chart with Refugee Recognition Rate for nationals from a
  specific country
- [`plot_ctr_population_type_abs()`](plot_ctr_population_type_abs.md) :
  Main country of origin - Absolute value
- [`plot_ctr_population_type_perc()`](plot_ctr_population_type_perc.md)
  : Main country of origin - Percentage
- [`plot_ctr_population_type_per_year()`](plot_ctr_population_type_per_year.md)
  : Graph of Population Type Over year
- [`plot_ctr_process()`](plot_ctr_process.md) : Asylum Processing
- [`plot_ctr_processing_time()`](plot_ctr_processing_time.md) : Plot
  Average processing time from registration to first instance asylum
  decision
- [`plot_ctr_pyramid()`](plot_ctr_pyramid.md) : Population Pyramid
- [`plot_ctr_recognition()`](plot_ctr_recognition.md) : Display a Chart
  with Refugee Recognition Rates
- [`plot_ctr_solution()`](plot_ctr_solution.md) : Plotting solutions
  within a country
- [`plot_ctr_solution_recognition()`](plot_ctr_solution_recognition.md)
  : Title
- [`plot_ctr_treemap()`](plot_ctr_treemap.md) : Tree map of Population
  Groups within a country

## Chart for Region

Charts adressing questions at regional or multicountry-level level

- [`plot_reg_decrease()`](plot_reg_decrease.md) : Plot Regional Decrease
- [`plot_reg_increase()`](plot_reg_increase.md) : Plot Regional Increase
- [`plot_reg_map()`](plot_reg_map.md) : Plot Regional Map
- [`plot_reg_origin_dest()`](plot_reg_origin_dest.md) : Plot Regional
  Origin Destination
- [`plot_reg_population_type_abs()`](plot_reg_population_type_abs.md) :
  Plot Regional Population Type Absolute
- [`plot_reg_population_type_per_year()`](plot_reg_population_type_per_year.md)
  : Plot Regional Population Type per Year
- [`plot_reg_prop_origin()`](plot_reg_prop_origin.md) : Plot Regional
  Proportion Origin
- [`plot_reg_rsd()`](plot_reg_rsd.md) : Plot Regional RSD
- [`plot_reg_share()`](plot_reg_share.md) : Plot Regional Share
- [`plot_reg_solution()`](plot_reg_solution.md) : Plot Regional Solution
- [`plot_reg_treemap()`](plot_reg_treemap.md) : Plot Regional Treemap

- [`template_RegPrez()`](template_RegPrez.md) : Generate all country
